entries.title: Your Monday Briefing: The Impact of a U.S. Chip-Making Boom
entries.description: Also, North Korea threatens nuclear escalation and Ukraine reinforces its resilience amid a deadly assault.

entries.title: Russian Airstrikes Pummel Ukrainian Civilians
entries.description: Ten months into the war, Ukraine has turned the tide in ground combat, but its cities are still facing relentless waves of missiles and exploding drones.

entries.title: A Stinky Stew on Cape Cod: Human Waste and Warming Water
entries.description: Climate change is contributing to electric-green algae blooms. Massachusetts wants a cleanup of the antiquated septic systems feeding the mess, but it could cost billions.

entries.title: As Lula Becomes Brazil’s President, Bolsonaro Flees to Florida
entries.description: Brazil inaugurates its new president, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, on Sunday. Facing investigations, former President Jair Bolsonaro has taken refuge in Orlando.

entries.title: Jailed Putin Critics in Russia Offer New Year Messages
entries.description: Seasonal greetings from imprisoned opponents offered counterprogramming of a sort to the traditional end-of-year speech from President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

entries.title: U.S. Pours Money Into Chips, but Even Soaring Spending Has Limits
entries.description: Amid a tech cold war with China, U.S. companies have pledged nearly $200 billion for chip manufacturing projects since early 2020. But the investments are not a silver bullet.

entries.title: U.S. Pours Money Into Chips, but Even Soaring Spending Has Limits
entries.description: Amid a tech cold war with China, U.S. companies have pledged nearly $200 billion for chip manufacturing projects since early 2020. But the investments are not a silver bullet.

entries.title: A New Puzzle Turns Earth Into a Rubik’s Cube, But More Complex
entries.description: Continental Drift is one of Henry Segerman’s latest efforts to make mathematics “real.”

entries.title: North Korea Vows to Escalate Nuclear Threat Against the South
entries.description: Kim Jong-un told a Workers’ Party meeting that his country must mass-produce nuclear missiles that could hit South Korea.

entries.title: In Bucha, a Final Rampage Served as a Coda to a Month of Atrocities
entries.description: Hours before Russian troops began withdrawing from the suburban town, a Russian soldier left a trail of blood and devastated lives in a last paroxysm of violence.
